comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/] Umm ... its not Darling Harbour. This stretch of Hickson Road is in Walsh Bay. The raised roadway in the foreground extends from near the bottom of Ferry Lane. It now leads to the InterPark Bond Store One Car Park.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet] Yes, not Darling Harbour, but 3 March 1949 (a Thursday) looks about right from the vehicles.

I am wondering if the object of interest is the wooden truss bridge, later replaced by a metal one?

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: This is obviously Walsh Bay    which is not really Darling Harbour by any reasonable stretch of the definition.   Its the current location of the entrance of the Wharf Theatre.

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: Thanks everyone, caption amended to Walsh Bay!
